citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"org.coastalaction_ec2b8fbb-5482-46e2-af71-9e85d58b8922\", \"author\": [{\"given\": \"Alexa\", \"family\": \"Goodman\"}, {\"literal\": \"Clean Annapolis River Project (CARP)\"}, {\"literal\": \"ACAP Humber Arm\"}, {\"literal\": \"Civic Laboratory for Environmental Action Research (CLEAR)\"}, {\"literal\": \"Surface Science Western Laboratory (University of Western Ontario)\"}, {\"literal\": \"Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC)\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2020\", \"08\", \"13\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Le but du Projet de recherche sur les microplastiques du Canada atlantique (2017-2020) est de d\u00e9terminer la quantit\u00e9 de microplastiques dans trois collectivit\u00e9s c\u00f4ti\u00e8res du Canada atlantique. Les donn\u00e9es serviront \u00e0 mieux \u00e9clairer la conversation et \u00e0 trouver des solutions concernant la pollution par les plastiques dans la r\u00e9gion. Le projet est financ\u00e9 par Environnement et Changement climatique Canada et est en partenariat avec le projet Clean Annapolis River Project (CARP), l'ACAP Humber Arm et le Dr Max Liboiron du Civic Laboratory for Environmental Action Research (CLEAR) de l'Universit\u00e9 Memorial de Terre-Neuve (MUN). Le Dr Max Liboiron est notre conseiller acad\u00e9mique en chef dans le cadre du projet de 3 ans. Il aide \u00e0 l'\u00e9laboration du projet, aux m\u00e9thodes et au protocole ainsi qu'\u00e0 la conception de l'\u00e9chantillonnage. Le projet comprenait l'\u00e9chantillonnage des eaux de surface et des s\u00e9diments de plage aux trois emplacements de l'\u00e9tude. L'\u00e9quipement de chalutage en eaux de surface a \u00e9t\u00e9 construit \u00e0 l'aide de la conception de l'instrument \u00e0 faible d\u00e9bris aquatiques (LADI) de CLEAR. Des rapports de donn\u00e9es sont disponibles pour les r\u00e9sultats des eaux de surface et des s\u00e9diments riverains de 2018. Les r\u00e9sultats restants de 2018 sur les s\u00e9diments et les donn\u00e9es sur les points chaud de 2019 seront bient\u00f4t disponibles.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Projet de recherche sur les plastiques marins du Canada atlantique (2017-2020)\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"https://catalogue.cioosatlantic.ca/dataset/org-coastalaction_ec2b8fbb-5482-46e2-af71-9e85d58b8922?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"org.coastalaction_ec2b8fbb-5482-46e2-af71-9e85d58b8922\", \"author\": [{\"given\": \"Alexa\", \"family\": \"Goodman\"}, {\"literal\": \"Clean Annapolis River Project (CARP)\"}, {\"literal\": \"ACAP Humber Arm\"}, {\"literal\": \"Civic Laboratory for Environmental Action Research (CLEAR)\"}, {\"literal\": \"Surface Science Western Laboratory (University of Western Ontario)\"}, {\"literal\": \"Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC)\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2020\", \"08\", \"13\"]}], \"abstract\": \"The purpose of the Atlantic Canada Microplastic Research Project (2017-2020) is to determine the quantity of microplastics in 3 near-shore communities of Atlantic Canada.  Data will be used to better inform the conversation and solutions around plastic pollution in the region.  The project is funded by Environment and Climate Change Canada and is in partnership with Clean Annapolis River Project (CARP), ACAP Humber Arm, and Dr. Max Liboiron at the Civic Laboratory for Environmental Action Research (CLEAR) out of Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN).  Dr.  Max Liboiron is our chief academic advisor on the 3-year project, assisting with project development, methods and protocol, and sampling design.  The project included sampling both surface water and beach sediment at all three study locations.  The surface water trawling equipment was built using CLEAR''s low-aquatic debris instrument (LADI) design.  Data reports are available for 2018 surface water and shoreline sediment results. Remaining 2018 sediment results and 2019 hot-spot data will be available soon.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Atlantic Canada Marine Plastic Research Project (2017-2020)\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"https://catalogue.cioosatlantic.ca/dataset/org-coastalaction_ec2b8fbb-5482-46e2-af71-9e85d58b8922?local=en\"}]

      			<mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">				
        				<gco:CharacterString>The purpose of the Atlantic Canada Microplastic Research Project (2017-2020) is to determine the quantity of microplastics in 3 near-shore communities of Atlantic Canada.  Data will be used to better inform the conversation and solutions around plastic pollution in the region.  The project is funded by Environment and Climate Change Canada and is in partnership with Clean Annapolis River Project (CARP), ACAP Humber Arm, and Dr. Max Liboiron at the Civic Laboratory for Environmental Action Research (CLEAR) out of Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN).  Dr.  Max Liboiron is our chief academic advisor on the 3-year project, assisting with project development, methods and protocol, and sampling design.  The project included sampling both surface water and beach sediment at all three study locations.  The surface water trawling equipment was built using CLEAR''s low-aquatic debris instrument (LADI) design.  Data reports are available for 2018 surface water and shoreline sediment results. Remaining 2018 sediment results and 2019 hot-spot data will be available soon.</gco:CharacterString>				
          				<lan:PT_FreeText>					
            					<lan:textGroup>						
              						<lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="#fr">Le but du Projet de recherche sur les microplastiques du Canada atlantique (2017-2020) est de dterminer la quantit de microplastiques dans trois collectivits ctires du Canada atlantique. Les donnes serviront  mieux clairer la conversation et  trouver des solutions concernant la pollution par les plastiques dans la rgion. Le projet est financ par Environnement et Changement climatique Canada et est en partenariat avec le projet Clean Annapolis River Project (CARP), l'ACAP Humber Arm et le Dr Max Liboiron du Civic Laboratory for Environmental Action Research (CLEAR) de l'Universit Memorial de Terre-Neuve (MUN). Le Dr Max Liboiron est notre conseiller acadmique en chef dans le cadre du projet de 3 ans. Il aide  l'laboration du projet, aux mthodes et au protocole ainsi qu' la conception de l'chantillonnage. Le projet comprenait l'chantillonnage des eaux de surface et des sdiments de plage aux trois emplacements de l'tude. L'quipement de chalutage en eaux de surface a t construit  l'aide de la conception de l'instrument  faible dbris aquatiques (LADI) de CLEAR. Des rapports de donnes sont disponibles pour les rsultats des eaux de surface et des sdiments riverains de 2018. Les rsultats restants de 2018 sur les sdiments et les donnes sur les points chaud de 2019 seront bientt disponibles.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>						
            					</lan:textGroup>					
          				</lan:PT_FreeText>				
      			</mri:abstract>

name: org-coastalaction_ec2b8fbb-5482-46e2-af71-9e85d58b8922
notes: The purpose of the Atlantic Canada Microplastic Research Project (2017-2020) is to determine the quantity of microplastics in 3 near-shore communities of Atlantic Canada.  Data will be used to better inform the conversation and solutions around plastic pollution in the region.  The project is funded by Environment and Climate Change Canada and is in partnership with Clean Annapolis River Project (CARP), ACAP Humber Arm, and Dr. Max Liboiron at the Civic Laboratory for Environmental Action Research (CLEAR) out of Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN).  Dr.  Max Liboiron is our chief academic advisor on the 3-year project, assisting with project development, methods and protocol, and sampling design.  The project included sampling both surface water and beach sediment at all three study locations.  The surface water trawling equipment was built using CLEAR''s low-aquatic debris instrument (LADI) design.  Data reports are available for 2018 surface water and shoreline sediment results. Remaining 2018 sediment results and 2019 hot-spot data will be available soon.

notes_translated.en: The purpose of the Atlantic Canada Microplastic Research Project (2017-2020) is to determine the quantity of microplastics in 3 near-shore communities of Atlantic Canada. Dr.  Max Liboiron is our chief academic advisor on the 3-year project, assisting with project development, methods and protocol, and sampling design.  The project included sampling both surface water and beach sediment at all three study locations.  The surface water trawling equipment was built using CLEAR''s low-aquatic debris instrument (LADI) design.  Data reports are available for 2018 surface water and shoreline sediment results. Remaining 2018 sediment results and 2019 hot-spot data will be available soon.
notes_translated.fr: Le but du Projet de recherche sur les microplastiques du Canada atlantique (2017-2020) est de dterminer la quantit de microplastiques dans trois collectivits ctires du Canada atlantique. Les donnes serviront  mieux clairer la conversation et  trouver des solutions concernant la pollution par les plastiques dans la rgion. Le projet est financ par Environnement et Changement climatique Canada et est en partenariat avec le projet Clean Annapolis River Project (CARP), l'ACAP Humber Arm et le Dr Max Liboiron du Civic Laboratory for Environmental Action Research (CLEAR) de l'Universit Memorial de Terre-Neuve (MUN). Le Dr Max Liboiron est notre conseiller acadmique en chef dans le cadre du projet de 3 ans. Il aide  l'laboration du projet, aux mthodes et au protocole ainsi qu' la conception de l'chantillonnage. Le projet comprenait l'chantillonnage des eaux de surface et des sdiments de plage aux trois emplacements de l'tude. L'quipement de chalutage en eaux de surface a t construit  l'aide de la conception de l'instrument  faible dbris aquatiques (LADI) de CLEAR. Des rapports de donnes sont disponibles pour les rsultats des eaux de surface et des sdiments riverains de 2018. Les rsultats restants de 2018 sur les sdiments et les donnes sur les points chaud de 2019 seront bientt disponibles.

description_translated.fr:
CIOOS-Atlantic est un consortium dinstitutions partenaires engages dans le dveloppement de la gestion et la diffusion des donnes ocanographiques de la cte Atlantique, du Labrador  la frontire entre le Maine et le Nouveau-Brunswick.

La collaboration continue avec un large ventail de parties prenantes fait partie intgrante de CIOOS-Atlantique, et nous travaillerons pour rpondre aux besoins de la communaut ocanographique et veiller  ce que les intrts rgionaux soient reprsents au niveau national. L'accent est mis sur la cration d'un systme qui facilite l'accs aux donnes afin de soutenir le travail des partenaires, chercheurs, industries, etc.
description_translated.en:
CIOOS-Atlantic is a consortium of partner institutions which are committed to the development of a data management and dissemination approach for oceanographic data from the Atlantic Seaboard, a region spanning from Labrador to the Maine / New Brunswick border.

Meaningful engagement and ongoing communication with a broad variety of stakeholders is an integral component of CIOOS-Atlantic, and we will work to meet the needs of the local oceanographic community and ensure regional interests are represented at the national level. Emphasis is placed on the creation of a system which promotes easy data access and supports the work of partners, researchers, industry, and more.
